p: 'Virus complexes transmitted by mosquitoes' (JEV and related encephalitis virus complex)-The mosquito-borne flaviviruses infect a variety of animal species and humans, with birds being most important to the enzootic transmission cycle of many of these viruses. Culex mosquitoes are the main vectors of these viruses. The following flaviviruses are members of this group [ 126]: 1) JEV (Japanese encephalitis [JE]) in Southeast Asia, 2) West Nile virus (WNV; West Nile fever/encephalitis) in Africa, North America, Europe, and Asia, 3) St. Louis encephalitis virus (SLEV; St. Louis encephalitis) in North and South America, 4) Kunjin virus (KUN; Kunjin virus encephalitis) in Australia, 5) Murray Valley encephalitis virus (MVEV; Murray Valley encephalitis) in Australia and New Guinea, 6) Rocio virus (Rocio encephalitis) in South America, and 7) Usutu virus in Africa and Europe.
